title: Stage S03
description: Level 1 grammar practice focusing on stage-specific patterns and expressions.
learning_points: Level 1 target grammar and expressions with practical usage examples

sentences.en: I played soccer yesterday.
She went home.
We watched a movie last night.
He ate breakfast at 8 o'clock.
They visited the museum.
You helped me a lot.
My father worked late.
It rained yesterday.
The store closed at 9 PM.
I learned English at school.
I played soccer yesterday.
She went home.
We watched a movie last night.
He ate breakfast at 8 o'clock.
They visited the museum.
You helped me a lot.
My father worked late.
It rained yesterday.
The store closed at 9 PM.
I learned English at school.
I have been studying English for 2 hours.
She has been living in Busan since 2020.

sentences.kr: 하루 종일 비가 오고 있어요. (날씨 지속)
sentences.en: It has been raining all day.
We have been waiting for you.

sentences.kr: 그는 최근에 매우 열심히 일하고 있어요. (노력 지속)
sentences.en: He has been working very hard lately.

sentences.kr: 한국어를 배운 지 얼마나 되었나요? (기간 질문)
sentences.en: How long have you been learning Korean?
I have been feeling tired recently.

sentences.kr: 그들은 이 문제를 논의하고 있어요. (회의 지속)
sentences.en: They have been discussing this issue.

sentences.kr: 제 전화가 10분 동안 울리고 있어요. (소리 지속)
sentences.en: My phone has been ringing for 10 minutes.
What have you been doing today?
I have been studying English for 2 hours.
She has been living in Busan since 2020.

sentences.kr: 하루 종일 비가 오고 있어요. (날씨 지속)
sentences.en: It has been raining all day.
We have been waiting for you.

sentences.en: He has been working very hard lately.

sentences.en: How long have you been learning Korean?
I have been feeling tired recently.

sentences.en: They have been discussing this issue.

sentences.kr: 제 전화가 10분 동안 울리고 있어요. (소리 지속)
sentences.en: My phone has been ringing for 10 minutes.
What have you been doing today?
